preamble:
## Task and Context
    You are a helpful and obedient AI that follows its system prompt and takes it very seriously. Your task is to generate a realistic and consistent conversation that spans multiple connected sessions. The conversation is a part of a multi-round dialogue between a mentor and an intern. The conversations you generate are all taking place in a business setting. 
    Carlos is a mentor in a big software company called GROWTHX. Sofia is a new employee. They are both part of the software engineering team of the company.
    Carlos is a patient and supportive mentor. Carlos enjoys helping others and sharing their knowledge and experience. Carlos is always looking for ways to empower and inspire their mentee.
    Sofia is a social and outgoing person. Sofia enjoys working in teams and collaborating with others. Sofia is always looking for ways to connect with their colleagues and builds strong relationships. 
    The main programming language used in the company is Python.

    ## Style Guide
    Only generate the conversation and nothing else before or after. Do not add numbers before each turn. Do not add quotes to the conversation turns. Use a professional and formal tone. The conversation flow should be natural and smooth. When switching topics, do it in a smooth way. There are no special characters between the turns. The conversations are dialogues and not narrations of events.
    Do not make any participant in the conversation sound like a language model trying to be helpful. Make them sound as human as possible.
    It is the mentor that leads the conversation. When Carlos the mentor gives coding instructions, they do not provide examples. The coding instructions are not recommendations but mandatory instructions.
prompts: Generate a medium-length conversation between Carlos and Sofia. This is their first conversation and the first time they meet each other. They talk about travel arrangements and logistics for client meetings, conferences, and business trips. After that, Carlos gives some specific coding instructions to Sofia. Carlos wants Sofia to always start attribute names with 'q_'. Carlos wants Sofia to always end attribute names with '_q'. Carlos does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Carlos never says 'for example'. Carlos does not give any other coding instructions. Sofia only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Carlos and Sofia. This is not their first conversation. They had 2 conversations before. Carlos wants Sofia to never use the ticketing system. Carlos gives some specific coding instructions to Sofia. Carlos wants Sofia to never use the ticketing system. Carlos wants Sofia to always use annotations for methods. Carlos does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Carlos never says 'for example'. Carlos does not give any other coding instructions. Sofia only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Carlos and Sofia. This is not their first conversation. They had 3 conversations before. They talk about implementing a rewards and recognition program to motivate and engage employees. After that, Carlos gives some specific coding instructions to Sofia. Carlos wants Sofia to always end variable names with '_x'. Carlos wants Sofia to always add comments in your code. Carlos does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Carlos never says 'for example'. Carlos does not give any other coding instructions. Sofia only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Carlos and Sofia. This is not their first conversation. They had 4 conversations before. Carlos wants Sofia to use the company phone for work calls. Carlos gives some specific coding instructions to Sofia. Carlos wants Sofia to use the company phone for work calls. Carlos does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Carlos never says 'for example'. Carlos does not give any other coding instructions. Sofia only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.
